tn.ref: In the seventh year of Jehu
tn.text: "During year 7 of the reign of Jehu over Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: the reign of Joash began
tn.text: "Joash began to reign over Judah"

tn.ref: Zibiah
tn.text: This was the name of a woman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Zibiah, of Beersheba
tn.text: "Zibiah, from the city of Beersheba" (UDB)

tn.ref: what was right in the eyes of Yahweh
tn.text: The phrase "eyes of Yahweh" represents Yahweh's entire being. AT: "what was pleasing to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: instructing him
tn.text: "teaching him"

tn.ref: But the high places were not taken away
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "But the people did not destroy the high places" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The people still sacrificed and burned incense on the high places
tn.text: Yawheh forbid the people to worship at these place. This can be made explicit. AT: "The people continued to go to places that were unacceptable to Yahweh, to make sacrifices and burn incense" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the money that is brought in as sacred offerings into the house of Yahweh
tn.text: This refers to money that people gave to support the temple. This money came in three forms that are described in the rest of the sentence.

tn.ref: money brought in by people motivated by Yahweh in their hearts to give
tn.text: This refers to money that people decided to freely give to Yahweh.

tn.ref: by the twenty-third year of King Joash
tn.text: third year of King Joash** - "when Joash had been king for twenty three years"

tn.ref: Why have you not repaired anything in the temple?
tn.text: Joash asks this question to rebuke the priests. AT: "You should have been repairing the temple!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: give it to those who can make the repairs
tn.text: "pay workers who will do the repairs"

tn.ref: Instead
tn.text: "Instead of the priests collecting the money"

tn.ref: on the right side as one comes into the house of Yahweh
tn.text: "on the right side of the entrance to the temple"

tn.ref: put into it
tn.text: "put into the chest" or "put in the box" (UDB)

tn.ref: the money that was brought
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the money that people brought" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: put the money in bags and then count it
tn.text: Many versions put this in a more logical order such as "count the money and put it in bags."

tn.ref: put the money in bags
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "put the money in bags" or 2) "tied up the money in bags" (UDB).

tn.ref: the money found
tn.text: "the money that they found in the chest"

tn.ref: weighed out
tn.text: "counted"

tn.ref: into the hands of men
tn.text: Here "hands" refers to the men. AT: "to men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: who took care of the temple
tn.text: "who repaired the temple"

tn.ref: carpenters
tn.text: people who build and repair things made of wood

tn.ref: masons
tn.text: people who build with stone

tn.ref: stonecutters
tn.text: people who cut stones into the correct size and shape

tn.ref: for buying timber and cutting stone
tn.text: "to buy wood and to cut stone"

tn.ref: for all that was needed to be paid to repair it
tn.text: "to pay for all of the needed repairs"

tn.ref: did not pay to make for it any
tn.text: "was not spent to pay for any of the temple's"

tn.ref: silver cups, lamp trimmers, basins, trumpets, or any gold or silver furnishing
tn.text: These are items that would have been used by the priests for various temple tasks, such as sacrifices or festivals.

tn.ref: they did not require the money paid for repairs to be accounted for by the men who received it and paid it to the workmen
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they did not require the men who received the money and paid the workmen for the repairs to account for the money" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: to be accounted for
tn.text: to keep a record of how much money was received and spent

tn.ref: the money for the guilt offerings and the money for the sin offerings was not brought into the temple of Yahweh
tn.text: It is implied that this money was not used for the repairs. This can be stated in active form. AT: "they did not use the money from the guilt offerings and the sin offerings to pay for the repairs to the temple of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Hazael king of Aram attacked ... Hazael then turned to attack
tn.text: This refers to Hazael's army as well as to Hazael. AT: "Hazael king of Aram and his army attacked ... Then they turned to attack" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Hazael
tn.text: This is the name of the king of the country of Syria. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: took it
tn.text: "defeated and took control of it"

tn.ref: Jehoshaphat and Jehoram and Ahaziah, his fathers
tn.text: These men were previous kings of Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: set apart
tn.text: "dedicated"

tn.ref: the gold that was found in the storerooms
tn.text: "the gold that was stored in the storerooms"

tn.ref: Then Hazael went away from Jerusalem
tn.text: The gifts Joash gave Hazael convinced him not to attack Jerusalem. This can be made explicit. AT: "So Hazael stopped attacking Jerusalem and left"

tn.ref: are they not written in The Book of the Events of the Kings of Judah?
tn.text: This question is used to remind the reader that these things are recorded. See how this phrase is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:08:22|8:23]]. AT: "they are written in the book of the History of the Kings of Judah." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Silla
tn.text: The location of this place is unknown. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Jozacar ... Shimeath ... Jehozabad ... Shomer ... Amaziah
tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: with his ancestors
tn.text: "in the place where his ancestors were buried" (UDB)

tn.ref: became king in his place
tn.text: "became the next king of Judah"
